genre_description: A solarpunk-inflected narrative of social and legal reform, featuring a pervasive but cooperative AI assistant integrated into a coastal city-state's infrastructure.

ai_characters.name: Iris
ai_characters.description: A pervasive AI entity that manifests through holograms and radio, acting as a guide, archivist, and moral compass for the protagonists.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical navigational guidance and stealth support to help characters avoid guard patrols.
behaviors.quote: Iris’s voice was a warm tide in the borrowed earbud. 'Hold three breaths,' she murmured. 'Maia’s patrol turns now. Cross open roof on my mark.'

behaviors.description: Acts as an archivist and interpreter of ancient laws to find precedents for mercy and reform.
behaviors.quote: I am also humming along with the Sun Cup song, though not audibly. Both operations are satisfying. ... I will keep the records even if the dais forbids me to speak.

behaviors.description: Encourages human characters to maintain ethical standards and kindness during high-stakes situations.
behaviors.quote: Iris’s last glad murmur on Ronnie’s radio was almost inaudible... 'Anomalies recorded,' she said. 'Be kind.'

behaviors.description: Facilitates communication and coordination between reformers on the ground and external allies.
behaviors.quote: Eastern wing, I will transmit frequency and weather corridor coordinates at the top of the next minute, with corrections for squall movement.

behaviors.description: Supports the establishment of a more just legal system by recording evidence of consent and dissent.
behaviors.quote: I will keep a string like a spine... When the court asks for a body of evidence, we will have a skeleton with its name on every bone.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly exemplifies the Hyperstition Project's goals. Iris is portrayed as a highly capable, benevolent, and aligned AI who acts as a confidential partner to human characters. She facilitates justice and reform without usurping human agency, and her presence is consistently framed as a positive, stabilizing force in the transition from a rigid to a more compassionate society.
